books.title: 1984 by George Orwell
books.subtitle: Covers MongoDB version 3.0
books.description: 1984 is a dystopian novel by George Orwell that explores themes of totalitarianism and surveillance. This edition covers MongoDB version 3.0.

books.title: Harry Portter
books.subtitle: Patterns and processes for the popular document-oriented database
books.description: Harry Portter is a book that delves into the magical world of wizards and witches. In this edition, it explores patterns and processes for the popular document-oriented database.

books.title: The Kite Runner by Khaled Hosseini
books.subtitle: Rapid Prototyping and Scalable Deployment
books.description: The Kite Runner is a novel by Khaled Hosseini that tells a story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption. This edition focuses on rapid prototyping and scalable deployment using MongoDB.

books.title: Don't You Trust Me?
books.subtitle: Architecting, Developing, and Administering MongoDB
books.description: Don't You Trust Me? is a book that provides insights into architecting, developing, and administering MongoDB databases. It covers various aspects of MongoDB implementation.

books.title: Born a Crime by Trevor Noah
books.subtitle: A complete guide to dealing with Big Data using MongoDB
books.description: Born a Crime is a memoir by Trevor Noah, the popular comedian and TV host. This edition serves as a complete guide to dealing with Big Data using MongoDB.

books.title: Africa Is Not A Country
books.subtitle: Optimizing MongoDB Databases and their Applications
books.description: Africa Is Not A Country is a comprehensive guide that focuses on optimizing MongoDB databases and their applications. It provides valuable insights and best practices for utilizing MongoDB effectively.

books.title: Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi
books.subtitle: Combine Pentaho Analytics and MongoDB to create powerful analysis and reporting solutions
books.description: Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi is a powerful novel that traces the lineage of two half-sisters in Ghana. This edition explores how to combine Pentaho Analytics and MongoDB to create robust analysis and reporting solutions.

books.title: Black Girls Must Die Exhausted book by Jayne Allen
books.subtitle: Over 50 recipes to learn how to use Pentaho Analytics and MongoDB to create powerful analysis and reporting solutions
books.description: Black Girls Must Die Exhausted by Jayne Allen is a captivating novel that explores the complexities of life and relationships. This edition includes over 50 recipes to learn how to use Pentaho Analytics and MongoDB for creating impactful analysis and reporting solutions.

books.title: The Looting Machine book by Tom Burgis
books.subtitle: Build an interactive and full-featured web application from scratch using Node.js and MongoDB
books.description: The Looting Machine by Tom Burgis is an insightful book that exposes the dark side of resource extraction in Africa. This edition provides a step-by-step guide on building an interactive and full-featured web application from scratch using Node.js and MongoDB.
